docs.text:
RSmartlyIO User Manual


Loading Facebook and Instagram Advertising Data from Smartly.io


Welcome to the official documentation of the R Smartly.io package for Facebook and Instagram advertising data.  


RSmartlyIO enables users of the R Language for Statistical Computing to directly access their 
smartly.io account
 in order to consume and analyze information provided by the smartly.io API.


General


RSmartlyIO is a license cost free open source project by 
@jburkhardt
 and 
@mbannert
.


RSmartlyIO loads Facebook and Instagram advertising data from the smartly.io API directly into R. Smartly.io is an online advertising service that enables advertisers to display ads on social media networks. The package offers an interface to query the Smartly.io API and loads data directly into R for further data processing and data analysis.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Loading Facebook and Instagram Advertising Data from Smartly.io  Welcome to the official documentation of the R Smartly.io package for Facebook and Instagram advertising data.    RSmartlyIO enables users of the R Language for Statistical Computing to directly access their  smartly.io account  in order to consume and analyze information provided by the smartly.io API.

docs.text: RSmartlyIO is a license cost free open source project by  @jburkhardt  and  @mbannert .  RSmartlyIO loads Facebook and Instagram advertising data from the smartly.io API directly into R. Smartly.io is an online advertising service that enables advertisers to display ads on social media networks. The package offers an interface to query the Smartly.io API and loads data directly into R for further data processing and data analysis.
docs.title: General

docs.text:
Installation


The package can be installed either from 
github
 or 
CRAN
.


Github


require(devtools)
install_github('rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO')




Source: 
https://github.com/rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO


CRAN


install.packages(
RSmartlyIO
)




Source: 
https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RSmartlyIO/index.html
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: The package can be installed either from  github  or  CRAN .
docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
require(devtools)
install_github('rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO')  Source:  https://github.com/rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO
docs.title: Github

docs.text: install.packages( RSmartlyIO )  Source:  https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RSmartlyIO/index.html
docs.title: CRAN

docs.text:
Requirements


In order to access the smartly.io API you have to meet the following requirements:  




smartly.io account


Valid smartly.io account Id


Valid API token




Missing one of the above mentioned items you cannot access the smartly.io API. The API token usually will be provided by your smartly.io account manager.
docs.title: Requirements

docs.text: In order to access the smartly.io API you have to meet the following requirements:     smartly.io account  Valid smartly.io account Id  Valid API token   Missing one of the above mentioned items you cannot access the smartly.io API. The API token usually will be provided by your smartly.io account manager.
docs.title: Requirements

docs.text:
Installation


require(devtools)
install_github('rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO')




Query smartly.io API and load data as dataframe


data 
- getSmartlyData(start = 
2016-03-01
,
                       end = 
2016-03-02
,
                       date = 
date
,
                       accountID=
*****************
,
                       accountInfo = F,
                       campaignStructure = c(
campaign_name
, 
campaign_fb_id
),
                       billing = c(
bid.optimization_goal
, 
bid.billing_event
),
                       targeting = c(
targeting.geo_locations.countries
),
                       creative = c(
creative_meta.call_to_action
),
                       #facebook = 
age
,
                       apiToken=
************************************
,
                       metrics = c(
impressions
,
clicks
))
docs.title: Quick Start

docs.text:
require(devtools)
install_github('rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO')
docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
data  - getSmartlyData(start =  2016-03-01 ,
                       end =  2016-03-02 ,
                       date =  date ,
                       accountID= ***************** ,
                       accountInfo = F,
                       campaignStructure = c( campaign_name ,  campaign_fb_id ),
                       billing = c( bid.optimization_goal ,  bid.billing_event ),
                       targeting = c( targeting.geo_locations.countries ),
                       creative = c( creative_meta.call_to_action ),
                       #facebook =  age ,
                       apiToken= ************************************ ,
                       metrics = c( impressions , clicks ))
docs.title: Query smartly.io API and load data as dataframe

docs.text:
Loading data


The package implements following features:




Authentication


Post the statement


Download the data


Return data as dataframe




These tasks are all handled by one function 
getSmartlyData()
. That´s all you need.


Build a statement


There are different segments that allow you to query the API.


Date


start
 - Beginning of date range. Format: "2016-05-01"


end
 - End of date range. Format: "2016-05-02"


date
 - Date aggregation level. One out of date, year, month, weekofyear, weekday


Account Information


Provides information about page name and account.


accountInfo
 - Account Information. TRUE/FALSE


Campaign Structure


campaignStructure
 - Campaign Information Selection. Vector with multiple arguments out of: campaign_name, campaign_fb_id, adgroup_name, adgroup_fb_id, name, id, fb_objective, campaign_start_date


Billing Information


billing
 - Billing Information Selection. Vector with multiple arguments out of: bid.optimization_goal, bid.billing_event


Campaign Targeting Information


targeting
 - Targeting Settings of Campaigns. Vector with multiple arguments out of: targeting.geo_locations.countries, targeting.geo_locations.cities, targeting.genders, targeting.age_min, targeting.age_max, targeting.interests, targeting.behaviors, targeting.custom_audiences, targeting.excluded_custom_audiences, targeting.connections, targeting.user_os, targeting.user_device, targeting.page_types


Creative/Ad Characteristics


creative
 - Creative/Ad Characteristics. Vector with multiple arguments out of: creative_meta.call_to_action, creative_meta, creative_meta.type, creative_meta.post_type, creative_meta.name, creative_meta.picture, creative_meta.post_fb_id, creative_meta.post_fb_link, creative_meta.text, creative_meta.title, creative_meta.link, creative_meta.url_tags


Facebook Settings


facebook
 - Facebook Settings. 
One argument only
 out of: age, country, gender, age_gender, placement, cross_device, region, hourly_stats_aggregated_by_advertiser_time_zone, hourly_stats_aggregated_by_audience_time_zone


Metrics


metrics
 - Metrics. Note: There are more metrics available. See the reporting section in the smartly.io interface. Vector with multiple arguments out of: impressions, ctr, cpm, cpc, spent, conversions, inline_link_clicks, clicks, cpa, reach, frequency, roi, revenue, social_impressions, social_clicks, website_clicks, newsfeed_clicks, deeplink_clicks, app_store_clicks, call_to_action_clicks, inline_post_engagement
docs.title: Query Data

docs.text:
Discovered any bugs?






Please make sure you run with the latest RSmartlyIO version before you report any issues.  






Do you have a valid API token?






If you are still in trouble, please report the issue on 
https://github.com/rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO/issues






We appreciate if you provide the following information along with the issue:




Operating System


R Version


RSmartlyIO version


the R code which leads to the error


the error message, prompt output


code as text rather than screenshots




We will try to get back to you as soon as possible!


Any other remarks, comments on the package or the documentation?

We appreciate any help in improving the package or documentation and look forward to your messages.
docs.title: Bug Reporting

docs.text:
Please make sure you run with the latest RSmartlyIO version before you report any issues.      Do you have a valid API token?    If you are still in trouble, please report the issue on  https://github.com/rstats-lab/RSmartlyIO/issues    We appreciate if you provide the following information along with the issue:   Operating System  R Version  RSmartlyIO version  the R code which leads to the error  the error message, prompt output  code as text rather than screenshots   We will try to get back to you as soon as possible!  Any other remarks, comments on the package or the documentation? 
We appreciate any help in improving the package or documentation and look forward to your messages.
